summary: The Boundary Waters Wilderness Protection and Pollution Prevention Act aims to protect the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness and surrounding areas in Minnesota. The bill focuses on withdrawing approximately 225,504 acres of federal land and waters from mining and mineral leasing to prevent potential pollution, specifically acid mine drainage, from copper and other metal mining. The legislation references past actions by the Forest Service and the Department of the Interior to protect the area's water quality, habitat, and tourism industry. It also provides for potential removal of certain materials if determined not detrimental.
